note:
Sentient anecdotal evidence, presenting in good faith.

Goal is to post citations and analysis, hoping the right intel can reach the right people at the right time to help.

Focusing on SARS-CoV-2 here. Other issues are also huge and pressing, but there's value in concentrating info streams.

Corrections most welcome.

Greatly appreciate the zeroes.ca community's caremongering and signal-to-noise ratio.

No tolerance for bad online actors of any stripe.

Trying to survive in unceded territory.

I was born the UK but moved to NZ as a child so identify as a Kiwi. Since 1989 I have lived in France and am now in Audierne on the Bretagne coast. Before retiring to Aufierne, I worked for 18 years for Public Services International, a France-based global federation of public sector trade unions. Before that I lived in New Zealand mainly working for unions and student bodies. My handle is @mikewaghorne@mstdn.socia

I'm an oldish autistic. No family, friends I don't see often enough. New to social media, this was my first account. If I share personal stories or opinions, that's my attempts to relate. My insights are based on imperfect knowledge, informing me is fine, but I block belligerence freely.

I follow a lot of people, I favorite or boost many things. If you see this, I probably like you. My issues are poverty and lack of consent. My base is biology, manufacturing, quality, and nerd stuff.

I'm an environmental economist who researches econ pedagogy to make learning economics marginally less dismal.

My pipe-dream is to write a fantasy novel/economics textbook, which is getting closer to reality every day.

#economics #TeachEcon #sustainability #DoughnutEconomics #degrowth

Profile pic is me smiling in front of a whiteboard with economics gibberish -- cause econ makes me happy.

Background is my dog, Freya, who is derpily sticking her tongue out while passed out.

fields.name: About me
fields.value: Making econ marginally less dismal one post at a time. I teach economics at the UC Denver and am an all around nerd. My goal is to combine my passion for all things fantasy/sci-fi and love of economics to lower the cost of learning econ.

fields.name: Fantastical Economics
fields.value: You can find my first-ever short story that covers the circular economy and sustainability in a sci-fi setting here: https://edgeryders.eu/t/circular-reasoning/19717

note: Who I am...I could not say. Beyond some tedious externals - years, mode of acquiring the means to exist, cultural inheritances and tastes - I appear to be entirely without substance, subject to continuous change. If therefore you find in me no affinity, wait; in another while perhaps we'll be as closest twins - until the wind changes and I change again.

I come from the great planet Earth, born as a "baby boomer" in Central Europe, meanwhile (still) living at the location mencioned below, with no expiration date in sight. PhD in physics from Technical University of Munich, Germany, retired since January 2017. Last project: www.caldose.org at the University of Pernambuco, Brazil.
Fierce anti-patriarchalist for more than 50 years. Happily married for 36 years until 2012, now an unhappy widower, living with my cat.
I know that I shall not see the end of the patriarchy (fucking male-dominant rule for the last 8 thousand years) in my remaining lifetime, but the recent DNC, USA gave me hope that self-extinction of humanity can be avoided by the relentless force and energy of women. Men should get out of the way, should become just drones (bees)!!!!

If all women have equal rights AGAIN, all kind of discrimination, war, global warming, environmental destruction, exploitation of nature, and slavery have disappeared, all citizens have secure, decent food, housing, health insurance, pension, free access to public transport, etc., then the prerequisites are created that all people can finally LOVE AND BE LOVED freely, lustfully, tenderly, carefree, with impunity, because THIS makes us humans.
